mean_cn: vi. 篡夺，篡位；  vt. 篡夺，强夺
mean_en: to take and keep (something, such as power) in a forceful or violent way and especially without the right to do so
sentence: Caesar was killed because the conspirators wanted to usurp his authority.
sentence_trans: 凯撒被杀是因为阴谋家们想要篡夺他的权利。
word_etyma: usu用 ＋ rp=rape抢掠 → 抢过来用 → usurp篡夺，侵占
